IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTION, INTERVENTION AND TREATMENT SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH SPECIAL HEALTH CARE NEEDS AND THEIR FAMILIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTION, INTERVENTION AND TREATMENT SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH SPECIAL HEALTH CARE NEEDS AND THEIR FAMILIES.
IRS990.Description: COMPREHENSIVE FAMILY AIDS PROGRAM (CFAP) PROVIDED AN EXTENSIVE ARRAY OF MEDICAL AND SOCIAL SERVICES TO SUPPORT THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF FAMILIES AFFECTED BY HIV/AIDS.

Activity2.Description: HOME-BASED INTERVENTION PROGRAM (HBIP) PROVIDED COMPREHENSIVE FOLLOW-UP CARE WHICH SERVED TO REDUCE THE INCIDENCE OF LIFE-THREATENING ILLNESS FOR LOW BIRTHWEIGHT, PRETERM AND HIGH-RISK INFANTS.

Activity3.Description: EARLY INTERVENTION PROGRAM (EIP) PROVIDED A SYSTEM OF EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND THERAPEUTIC SUPPORT FOR NEWBORNS THROUGH THREE YEARS OF AGE.

OtherLiabilities.Description: DUE TO THE NORTH BROWARD HOSPITAL DISTRICT

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION ENSURES THAT ALL CLIENT EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE FUNDS DISBURSED ARE IN LINE WITH EITHER THE PETTY CASH OR DONATED FUNDS DISBURSEMENT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PAGE 6, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AN INITIAL DRAFT IS REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT, CFO, AND CONTROLLER FOR ACCURACY BEFORE THE FORM 990 IS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PAGE 6, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE AND REITERATED REGULARLY AT SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND BOARD MEETINGS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PAGE 6, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A & 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION OF THE CEO, EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS AND TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS IS DETERMINED BY WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS, COMPENSATION SURVEYS/STUDIES, AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. AS IT RELATES TO THE COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES, THE ORGANIZATION PERFORMS MARKET COMPARABILITY ANALYSIS TO DETERMINE THE ADEQUACY OF POSITION PAY RATES, WHICH ARE PERIODICALLY ADJUSTED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PAGE 6, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST EITHER ON PAPER OR IN ELECTRONIC FORMAT.

1) RESEARCH PROGRAMS PARTICIPATED IN SEVERAL RESEARCH PROTOCOLS ADDRESSING HIV/AIDS ISSUES AS WELL AS SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND LONG TERM EFFECT OF PARENTAL COMPILATIONS. EXPENSES: $1,357,519 GRANT ALLOCATIONS: NONE REVENUES: $1,358,264 2) THE PEDIATRIC HIV PROGRAM PROVIDES A COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF CARE FOR INFANTS, CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS WHO ARE AT-RISK OR INFECTED WITH HIV. EXPENSES: $225,255 GRANT ALLOCATIONS: NONE REVENUES: $185,184 3) PROFESSIONAL STAFFING FOR A TELEPHONE TRIAGE COMPONENT OF URGENT CARE HEALTH GUIDANCE/EDUCATION FOR CDTC'S PRIMARY CARE CLINIC. EXPENSES: $15,000 GRANT ALLOCATIONS: NONE REVENUES: $15,000 4) MEDICATIONS NOT COVERED BY OTHER RESOURCES EXPENSES: $25,000 GRANT ALLOCATIONS: NONE REVENUES: $25,000
